text: Honduras at the Olympics is a history which began in 1968. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Honduras is HON. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Honduras has been in nine Summer Olympic Games. They were at the Winter Olympic Games in 1992. They have never won a medal. The Comité Olímpico Hondureño was formed in 1956 and recognized by the IOC the same year. ==Olympic table Summer== Games Athletes Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Athletes by sport Medals Medals Medals Games Athletes Mexico City 1 1 - - - - 0 0 0 Munich 1972 did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Montreal 1976 3 3 - - - - 0 0 0 Moscow 1980 did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Los Angeles 1984 8 3 5 - - - 0 0 0 Seoul 1988 8 3 3 2 - - 0 0 0 Barcelona 1992 10 4 4 - 1 1 0 0 0 Atlanta 1996 4 1 1 2 - - 0 0 0 Sydney 2000 3 1 2 - - - 0 0 0 Athens 2004 3 1 2 - - - 0 0 0 Bejiing 2008 4 2 2 - - - 0 0 0 ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Honduras profile at London2012.com * Honduras at SportsReference.com Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Honduras
